column3: A bleak day today for $COUNTRY$, as $CAPITAL$'s financial district reels from the shock of a burst speculation bubble. His other great work, 'The Old Regime and the French Revolution', was published in 1856 just three years before his death.

column2: 【$COUNTRY$】1894年、パリのドイツ驻在武官邸で、フランスのスパイが手书きのメモを发见した。そのメモの内容には、フランス军の机密情报が含まれていた。フランス军による内部调查の结果、被疑者としてユダヤ系のアルフレド鼍ドレフュス大尉が浮上した。军法会议はドレフュス大尉に有罪の判决を下し、南米の伛领ギアナ沧に浮かぶディアブル岛での终身城塞禁锢刑を言い渡した。ドレフュス大尉は一贯して无实を主张したものの、この时点では何の鳇果もなかった。

Later in 1898, it was found that much of the evidence against Dreyfus had been forged.

column3: In 1918, Gerard Manley Hopkins' collected poetry was published posthumously, even though Hopkins himself was uncomfortable with its publication during his lifetime. Hopkins poetry was modernist, but at the same time he was considered a religious poet. He had converted to Catholicism early in his life and was a student and professor of medieval Christian philosophy.

column3: Florence Nightingale has been recognised throughout the world as the founder of modern nursing. During a recent war, Britain's Minister of War appointed her 'Lady-In-Chief' to 38 nurses in army field hospitals. The success of this mission triggered the first nursing school in England and has led to the establishment a program to examine and reorganize the British Army's medical services. Nightingale also works in the area of public health, hospital administration, and sanitary reform. Long may glory shine upon this angel, popularly known as the lady with the lamp?
